intro: Sphaeralcea hastulata, commonly known as the prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sphaeralcea hastulata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
